website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive on-camera light that still produces a good amount of light and has some nice extras.
pros: Brightness is adjustable and the light comes with filters
Very compact and easy to transport
Features 160 LED lights that offer a lot of brightness
cons: Made with some cheaper materials, so can be a bit fragile

customer_reviews.title: Sweet.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great. I have used it in a couple of shoots since I got it, its very consistent and very bright. I'll upload some pictures.
customer_reviews.author: cycleography

customer_reviews.title: Newer Ones Have Greenish Tint
customer_reviews.text: Hmm have you guys noticed their new ones have a greenish tint to it? The top one is the one I bought 3-4 years ago. I needed another 2, but my new ones came in not at the same temperature. Even with the orange plastic part on both, the greener light still shows through. I'm pretty sure this is the same product cuz I just pressed buy again. No option for color temperature on the description. I'm going to have to return it. I wonder if I buy it again if they'll still come green.
customer_reviews.author: Audofit

customer_reviews.title: Great for Night Photography!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for night photography after a friend recommended it. There's a dail on the side you can use to gradually turn up the power on the light. I turn this on half power with the diffuser panel attached for night portraits with couples. It also works great without the diffuser panel for detail shots at receptions and ring shots. The only reason I gave this four stars is because it does not include the battery or charger. I feel for $30 it should include those items.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: This light is a good brightlight and comes with one diffuser and 3200k filter. It arrived one day then expected. It also as the capability of taking different batteries such as the Sony FM, Sony FM, Sony FH, Sony F series and Panasonic SD Series instead of only using the standard AA batteries. Only con is that it is delicately built. But all in all I do recommend this light for any photographer or videographer.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer s

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I use it to repair my car
customer_reviews.text: I love the price, I love the power output. I use it to fix my car in the dark. I power it with a Sony rechargable battery. It fits like a glove however !!! Once you turn it upside down or sideways the battery will fall off. The back cover has a large hole that battery will slip out of. To remedy this I added duct tape and that fixed my issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great led light
customer_reviews.text: In the photo i had every light off. Only light on was the NEEWER LED. Had it on low. Would light up the room if i had it set on high
customer_reviews.author: Carl hill

customer_reviews.title: BEST output for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a YouTuber and I needed a source of lighting for my shots as I have a darker skin tone and need more contrast. This was recommended to me by a photographer friend of mine. I've had a fantastic experience using it and you'll be able to tell from my video. It lights up shots excellently and makes up for the lackluster smartphone camera I use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Ya gets what ya pays for
customer_reviews.text: "ya gets what ya pays for". I can see a lot of potential applications for this light but not as a primary unit. The light it exudes seems to be fine, and the filters (diffusion and 3200) work ok. I don't know if they make additional filters for the unit but that'd be good if they do. Overall construction material seems pretty cheap. The battery compartment is open, thus exposing the batteries and connections to the elements like moisture and dust. The clamp for the hot shoe requires some manipulation to seat properly. Overall, I have to say that this unit strikes me as something I can use, but not count on.
customer_reviews.author: BruceG

customer_reviews.title: POWER DRAIN! Batteries are DEAD after sitting when unit is OFF!
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a nice light for the $$. However, you MUST remove all 6 batteries every time you're not using the device! If you don't, there's a power drain even when the unit is turned off. I would have never bought it if I had known this. They now indicate this is the product details, but what an inconvenience, since getting the batteries in/out is quite a chore and then you have to store them somewhere while on a shoot. Terrible design if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh

customer_reviews.title: For this price, Wow its a great light thanks!
customer_reviews.text: i got it without the battery pack, but it works great with AA. Again for this price im going to buy 2 more so its a great product.
customer_reviews.author: dre

customer_reviews.title: Blew My Mind....WOW😳😳
customer_reviews.text: Gotta say this blew my mind how bright this thing is. Glad I listened to the other reviews. Look at my video to see.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Grant

customer_reviews.title: ****BUYER BEWARE**** GARBAGE - STOPPED WORKING WITHOUT USING IT ONCE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and put Duracell batteries in to use when I video for my business. First time I used it (Unfortunately after the return window closed) it did not work. It has a problem with the dimmer type switch on the side that turns it on and off. When I turn the switch the light turns on and off intermittently but does not stay on. Now I have a $25 paperweight. I don't know how to contact the company and Amazon does not give me the ability to do so. Based on this I may have gotten a lemon but I can't make lemonade. SAVE YOUR MONEY, LOOK ELSEWHERE, ****BUYER BEWARE***
customer_reviews.author: BigFig94

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bright, but buy one of the camcorder batteries that fits and save money in the long run.
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend that if you DO purchase this or any similar devices that you also purchase at LEAST one LI-ION battery and charger, don't waste your money on high powered AA batteries, try to be a little greener than that. I bought the Wasabi Batteryand the Vivitar chargerfor same, don't make the mistake of relying on AA batteries, but if you need to in an emergency, they'll work in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy On Maui

customer_reviews.title: It’s good when it's working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Neewer 160 light for my Camera on Oct 1, 2018. When it arrived, I put it on the camera, it worked very well and I really like the idea of this light. It gave me a better light option than my expensive flash. Since then, I didn't have too much use of it. it was sitting in the camera bag until this Christmas... just when I need it for the family gathering photos. The lights wouldn't turn on and I have all the Panasonic eneloop 1900mAh batteries charged fully beforehand. I do not know what the problem is, it's just odd.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: This is great! But DRAINS batteries way fast. Luckily there's a cord to buy
customer_reviews.text: MAKE SURE you also pick up this cord below! It will allow you to plug the light into a wall outlet so you don't waste batteries like crazy! This light will eat through 6 AA duracell batteries in a matter of 2 hours on medium settings. -  its named "FocusFoto CN-AC2 DC 7.5V 2A Switching AC Power Supply Adapter for CN-160 CN-126 YN-160 YN-300 YN300 II YN-600 W260 5080LED 5010LED 5012LED 5010A AL-528 AL-198 Video LED light SONY NP-F550 NP-F970 F330"
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: Used once and already broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light a couple of weeks ago and only used it once. It worked fine when I first put the batteries on. But after a few days when I tried to take some indoor photos with it, it was already broken. I can barely turn it on and had to move the switch back and forth to find a spot that turns on the lights. And after one use it completely went down. The lights cannot be turned on anymore. I purchase a lot of things including camera gears in Amazon but this one is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Junk look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I dont know how many neewer products I need to buy before I learn my lesson. I have had this light for awhile but only used it for about 4-5 sessions before the plastic mounting bracket snapped off simply from the own weight of the light. I wasn't even trying to re-position the light when it snapped. Piece of junk- spend more money and get a decent lighting rig and save yourself the embarrassment of having your lighting rig smash to the ground while taking photos of a client...
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Good if you need bright light, not so good if you need really low light.
customer_reviews.text: The dimmer switch doesn't go from 0 to 100% more like 25-100%. Below 25% it just shuts off even though you have to keep spinning the dial further to turn it off. Usually not a problem unless you specifically need to use if for very low light like I did. Another weird thing is that my rechargeable AA batteries don't work in it. But disposable alkaline batteries do?!? Don't even know what is going on there. It will cover the bases for 90% of the people using it. And it's cheap. But it also feels cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B

customer_reviews.title: Really great for an even better price!
customer_reviews.text: This light exceeded all expectations I had for it! The filters and dimmer are awesome! Just be aware, that after using it at an event (about 3 hours in of both photo and video) while I was recording video, the light started to go wonky and would turn off on its own. I replaced the batteries and the problem minimized, but it is a little light and doesn't handle consistent use the best. A few weeks after the event I'm still having problems with the light going out, but it still works great and is reliable enough to shoot video. But, for the price, it can't be beat! Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No back for battery!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However, I don't get why it *does not* have a back leaving the batteries to be seen! Did mine simply just not come with one? I see others have stated no back also. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: William O.. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for in studio/tabletop video lighting...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for in studio video lighting--very bright but can control/dim the brightness. Nice daylight type light. I'm using AA batteries but may purchase the recharchable battery pack, depending on how well the lights hold up. However, they don't seem ruggedly built; if I needed equipment that I had to frequently take on the go, I'd probably look for lights with a little better quality housing that could withstand getting tossed into a bag, dropped, etc. These do feel like if they were dropped, the plastic housing would smash to bits... But for my needs (table top video tutorials for YouTube), they are quite sufficient, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ModGrandma

customer_reviews.title: half dead after 24hrs.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife to do online teaching to kids learning english, so she needed a brighter light source than rooms ambient lighting. Worked great for the 1st couple of times we were setting it up. Get ready to film online instruction and half (the bottom half) lights were completely out and top half did work.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic will brake faster than you ever expect.
customer_reviews.text: Made out the worst and flimsiest plastic ever, the screw that holds it down got striped the firs time I installed it on my camera then the base cracked!! Now I cannot mount it on anything!!! I tried to super glue it but it failed me again! Stay clear and don't get fooled by the price, it is made way cheaper than it's deceivingly "reasonable price", which in fact isn't reasonable at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Abdalkarem Al Abawi

customer_reviews.title: where additional lighting is always good to have in dark bars or stages
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 2 years now as music videographer, where additional lighting is always good to have in dark bars or stages. I use the regular AA batteries, and while I seldom used anything other than the lowest lighting level, the batteries lasted a good while before needing replacement, almost a full year after filming 2-3 bands a month!! So this Neewer is very energy efficient, and never gets too hot to deal with. And man, is it super bright when you need it!! Only complaint I have is that it's a bit tall, so you do need to get used to that.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Don't use this for skin tones or proper color reproduction. The CRI index on this is extremely low. Note that there is no listed CRI for this unit, but if you compare it with a better light (CRI95+) you will notice a huge difference and have trouble balancing colors. It's good in a pinch for filling a space and if very portable, but if you have the budget you're better off stepping up to something with consistent color reproduction.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S

customer_reviews.title: This light is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The dimmer control makes this light an absolute nightmare to work with. The dimmer is a cool idea but this is terrible. It’s extremely touchy. You slide it and the light turns off completely. It got to the point where I had to keep turning the wheel to get the light come on and if I moved the light at all, the light would just shut off completely. Absolutely useless on my long exposure shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: ... using the umbrella lights at all because this had better light. I definitely like the little plastic shields ...
customer_reviews.text: This light is surprisingly bright and effective - we set up a little photo shoot with this and some umbrella lights and ended up not using the umbrella lights at all because this had better light. I definitely like the little plastic shields you can put in to affect the color of the light - the amber one makes a nice warm light.
customer_reviews.author: E. C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold AA batteries securely.
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold AA batteries securely. Mine kept slipping out of place 90% of the time. If I was lucky, and I held it just right, the light looked good. It's probably fine with a battery pack, but for the added price of the battery pack, I went with the Viltrox model which included the battery pack, has better controls, adjustable color balance, more color gels, and supports an external per supply.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what the description says, a reasonably priced light for your camcorder. Were I a pro, I'm sure something better would be in order, but for my home recordings, this lights up the scenes just as I need. I've heeded the other reviewers cautions about leaving batteries in it--I'm still on my original sets of AAs. I recommend this for the casual videographer who just needs some more light on a small budget.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bad Example

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn the brightness all the way up, can't run for more than 30 minutes at 1/4 power.
customer_reviews.text: Bumping up to 3 stars as a replacement is on the way. I'll update again after it arrives. I'm using batteries to power this. While it's working it's great. However, the lights immediately shut off once I turn the brightness all the way up. If I set the power to about 50% the lights shut off after about 10-15 minutes. I can't imagine it would overheat so quickly, but that's the only reason I can think they would shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Die Quickly When Not in Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to be able to produce some different effects with my DSLR camera that I can't do with a flash. I received it early May of 2018 and by mid August the batteries had leaked out twice. The second time destroyed the unit. I hardly used the unit at all. Not sure if there's a slow drain on the batteries when the lamp is off but it's definitely got an inherent electrical defect. I was using good quality alkaline batteries both times and confirmed the lamp was off. There's no way new alkaline batteries should leak out in such a short time if they are new and not been in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Batteries won’t cut it
customer_reviews.text: One of the things I was gonna excited about was being able to use regular/rechargeable batteries so this light would be cordless. Absolute waste of your time. Fully charged batteries will last less than an hour. Unless you plan on using the other battery option, I wouldn’t recommend wasting your time on this. Considering that it’s an option, you would think it would actually be able to work with AA batteries, but it kills batteries like there’s no tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Best light ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best streaming light I have ever owned. I am a professional wedding photographer in Hawaii so I am always using lighting equipment. I own some really expensive professional lights but this one is honestly the best one I own. The price is extremely reasonable for the impeccable quality. You can adjust the brightness of the light and at its brightest it is actually really bright for this small little thing! I own 3 of them and I use them often. Highly recommend this light!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap Light that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: This one one of the few light I have for my camera and is definitely the brightest for its price. The only thing I don’t like about this light is that it requires 6 AAA batteries and they don’t last u very long. Definately don’t keep em in there as it’ll drain them even if you are not using them. It is on my Canon T7I for size comparison. This thing is quite heavy and large.
customer_reviews.author: Arefin S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Light! Worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: I film abandoned places, and I put this Neewer light on my grip, right above my camera! The LEDs are great and bright. I love how I can lower the brightness of light if it’s too bright. The price is great! Worth the money. I bought 2 so far and will buy more down the road. It’s great for travel because the lights are not that big. I recommend buying the charging pack for theses lights. I use batteries for a while and they don’t last too long due to how powerful the lights are! Buy it today!
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Solid light for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I’m a photojournalist at a local TV station. I bought this to have as an extra hair-light primarily when doing live shots in the dark. I have been well pleased with this light thus far. I’ve used it on many occasions. It fits on my light stands perfectly and have been very impressed with battery life (AA). Doesn’t take up much room, which is nice. I have bought Neewer products before and have enjoyed using most of them. I would recommend this light.
customer_reviews.author: Codie S.

customer_reviews.title: THE MOUNTING FOOT IS CHEAP BEYOND BELIEF.  BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: I had to dismantle and modify the mounting shoe with a file. The adjustment is impossibly tight even with the adjustment screw totally loose. I had to file down the teeth. Also, beware that the foot is screwed onto the light and the light casing is extremely thin and fragile. I've done well with about an hour's work to fix it. NOT FOR THOSE WHO AREN'T MECHANICALLY INCLINED!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's 2018, USB Charging Should be Required
customer_reviews.text: This lamb did the job, you will immediately notice that you need batteries and a lot of Double AA batteries to power it. With it's diffuser, it helped with softening and warming the light. Only bad thing about this to me would be the fact that it's heavy. Even sudden jerks around with my camera or rig would untighten the mounting and have the lamp fall forward or back. Highlights - It is bright - Comes with diffusers Cons: - It's Heavy, I dont recommend this if you want to be lightweight - Needs a lot of Double AA Batteries, which also adds onto the weight - No USB charger
customer_reviews.author: BrotherKehn

customer_reviews.title: Really nice light. Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: This light was a great buy for me. I have only used it once so far shooting a wedding video in low light. I thought it was going to feel very heavy with the batteries in it but it seemed ok mounted on my Canon 7D. Yes, it can really crank up the light. I was mostly shooting 5-10 ft. away from the subject so I kept the setting lower. If you were to look directly at it at full power you'll see just how bright it can be. I used rechargeable double AA batteries and did not need to change them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bucci

customer_reviews.title: Break out your wallet for batteries
customer_reviews.text: This thing uses a ton of batteries and gets heavy because of it. Spots for other batteries but of what type? Quality pretty flimsy. defuser plastic insert helps make the light not a spot Back panel not enclosed is weird showing the batteries. Design choice i suppose. note: you can wire in a transfer to replace the batteries and lighten the load if your handy.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for broadcasting live. Unfortunately, it times out way too quickly and there's apparently no way of keeping the light on for an extended period of time. I ended up returning it but if you need a portable backlight with dimming options, this would come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: Krissy Skye

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working entirely!
customer_reviews.text: I used this once. Put it away with all my other gear at home, and pulled it out yesterday for a wedding. Put fresh batteries in and it does not work at all. REALLY disappointed to have wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: LyonsDen

customer_reviews.title: Turn off the Lights cause NEEWER is in the house!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy... I was at a competition when I saw the make shift step and repeat and someone had this light... I unboxed it and turned out all the lights and took a test shot... OH YEAH>> clean crisp light.. my daughter is African American and she was lit perfectly. I was really shocked .. I thought maybe she will be a little yellow or shiny but I CAN'T WAIT to shoot with it in low light... the dimmer works well and there are plenty of levels in the lighting options... it come with an adapter to use several battery options.. BUY it and stick it in your camera bag.. you will never be caught in the dark...
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great budget LED.
customer_reviews.text: Great LED Light. I use it for film making more so. The nice thing is it comes with two diffusers and it has a reach of about 25-30 feet at full brightness. It can mount to a standard camera tripod which I recently started doing. I'm not sure how long the batteries I have in there will last but I've used it for night macro photography and a few filming gigs and have yet to need to change the batteries. Overall a great purchase. The build construction is very plastic and if you dropped it a few times you'd damage it. I'm a carefull person with my equipment so it works well.
customer_reviews.author: fulton

customer_reviews.title: Great BUT
customer_reviews.text: These lights are great! I rarely use them for photography, but I use them for my video podcasts I film. They get very bright and they’re portable which is amazing. My issue is waiting all that time for a full charge for it to go out in less than an hour. I’ll be filming live and the lights will start to dim after 45 minutes of staying on. I know it may not be meant to stay on that long, but it would be nice if they stayed on longer.
customer_reviews.author: Felice

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Doesn’t even work.
customer_reviews.text: Not a great light and I’m pretty disappointed with the light. I’ve never had luck getting it to work. Batteries don’t stay well in the spot for batteries. It doesn’t turn on and it’s very cheap. I wish I could return it but I’m passed the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright, versatile, and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Watch my video review here for a closer look! This is an excellent product. Here is my list of pros and cons: Pros: - Inexpensive. - Very bright! The 160 LED lights do not disappoint. - Works with easy to find AA batteries. - Nice battery indicator. Works even while turned off. - Easy to use. Just put in the batteries and you are set. - Extremely fast shipping (with Amazon Prime got it in one day). Cons: - Cheap materials. The light is mostly made out of plastic. I would recommend this light to anyone starting to work with video. The product is very versatile and can be used in many different projects for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: debaserphoto

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little light. It provides enough dimming flexibility to light up even the darkest room. This is a great fit on my DSLR rig and it will definitely give you that "Paranormal Activity" feel if you're looking for it but it's also great for night interviews. The color is a little on the cool side but nothing that can't be fixed with proper white balancing or post editing. On battery power this thing lasts well over an hour (haven't used it longer than that). For the price, you can't go wrong here. I actually can't think of anything I don't like about the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Webb

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced , great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Working excellent, used for 8 night shoots, includeing one a Milky Way time lapse, still showing 2 bars on battery charge. Using 5 AA. I’ve bought a second one and the generic Panasonic lithium rechargeable batteries, they haven’t stored as good as the AAs but fine for a vacation week of night photography. I’m setting these 50-150 feet from the foreground I’m lighting with the 3800K installed
customer_reviews.author: T. Gendron

customer_reviews.title: Top notch light for your camera.
customer_reviews.text: Really good value for the money. This LED lamp gets really good and bright. I have got a Canon Rebel camera. I suggest you buy two of these for you camera. Amazon dot com has got (or used to have) a bracket that you can fit to your camera where two of these lights can be mounted on one bracket - one on the left and one on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Norris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little light with way more power than it looks like it should have. It has a hard-outer shell and comes with two filters for daylight and tungsten. Also has some good battery life, allowing me to film for several hours on one charge. I got the rechargeable battery to use with it instead of using AA, which I recommend. This thing is awesome, inexpensive, bright, durable and can fit into a camera bag. Definitely a light worth keeping in your bag, even if you don't need it, it is a great backup.
customer_reviews.author: Akbar Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: and sometimes with weddings when the bridal party or groomsman are getting ready we don't have the best light. This is a perfect addition to my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for! I am a photographer, and sometimes with weddings when the bridal party or groomsman are getting ready we don't have the best light. This is a perfect addition to my camera bag! The light is bright and white, very consistent. The battery options. AAs or lithium ion makes this unit highly versatile. I did also find that it doesn't tend to get too terribly hot, as I have had issues with my other artificial light sources overheating​.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: okay for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because they were inexpensive and bar that in mind. One of them has had issues with the on-off switch. I thought it was resolved but if I don't take out one battery when I am not suing it the whole set of batteries go dead. Must not shut off completely even when it clicks. the light produced is good and they come with an orange filter.
customer_reviews.author: culdee

customer_reviews.title: This little light packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: Are use large box lights for auditions with my camcorder. This little light packs a punch. I can make it as bright as of my giant box light. I use it for travel so I don’t have to bring my large box lights. I love it. But I don’t like ordering the battery separately plus the battery that was recommended doesn’t keep a very good charge. FYI
customer_reviews.author: cameragirl

customer_reviews.title: Not the slimmest of designs out there, and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the slimmest of designs out there, and the battery compartments are not exactly precision fits, but the lights work well, have a decent CRI, and you get a lot of light on a small budget. Note: if you are using AA batteries, do NOT leave them in the light after use, as they will drain out oven of the light is turned off. That can get expensive..... Update - a few months later..... Bad idea....one has failed the other is failing. I do NOT recommend these lights....
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Every videographer needs one of these
customer_reviews.text: I love this light! Even with the things I don't like, if you're a videographer you really need one! The cons first: The way the battery goes in, it's stubborn and takes forever to get it in or out. The pros: it takes regular Panasonic TV camera batteries, which I already had... it has filters, it's dimmable, the color temp is not as cool as you would expect from LED, it's bright with a fairly decent throw, the battery lasts forever. I do weddings, and this thing was a Godsend compared to those awful battery belts.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Defective, returned for refund
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a chance to use this lamp as it was defective upon arrival. The light would not come on. I removed the corner screws to gain access to the inside and immediately noticed a black power wire was cut in half and the same wire was frayed near one of the soldered connections. I saw no way that this wire could have been damaged during assembly and obviously it could not be tested in that condition. When I connected the cut ends the light came on and looked pretty bright but I returned the unit for a refund. I would say there is a problem with quality control, at least with the person who put that one together.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: It was really good when it works but then the light keeps turning off . I have to change battery ( 6 -8 of them ) every 15 mins .. that’s a lot of batteries guys .. i expect it to last longer. What even more frustrated is that it keeps turning off while I’m doing my video... imagine how annoying that is .. I would not get it again
customer_reviews.author: first semester physic

customer_reviews.title: You will run out of batteries pretty quickly, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. I am a photography major and I got this led light for my school projects. I also purchased it bc the reviews online and on amazon said that it’s a good product in the “affordable range”. The light brightness is good but the problem is that it eats up the batteries & the quality of the material is very cheap. I replaced the batteries few times and it only last like 10 min., maybe. I really wish that I could get my money back! Sometimes is best to spend the little extra money and get something good than having to regret it later because you went with the cheapest option...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like this light due to it's mobility. It does well for the price. Easily attaches to the hotshoe at the top of the camera. Fairly durable, however, I wouldn't suggest dropping it. I have purchase 2 of these and bought the last one because a crew memer dropped it, and the back tab would not latch. Other than that, overall decent product. Good luck!!
customer_reviews.author: Cnote

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable light.
customer_reviews.text: If you do a lot of shooting indoors, you will need a portable lighting system. This one is excellent for the price and you can choose the brightness you need with the tuning dial. I get great footage indoors using this light. It takes rechargeable batteries (not included), as well as 6 AA batteries (also not included).
customer_reviews.author: Fred Adelman

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I use this lamp for both video and photo filming. Two comments to the makers: battery test works funky, it will often show 2 or 3, or in another case 3 to 4 lamps. I use high-quality Eneloop batteries so they are not the source of such floating measurement. And a suggestion - please include convertors to popular Nikon and Canon cameras, they'll be extremely handy. Otherwise, a great buy I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Iger Greene

customer_reviews.title: Boo! Poor performance... Eats batteries...
customer_reviews.text: The light is bright... but eats batteries quickly. Sent the first one back because you could turn it on and the light would quickly just turn off... well, it was eating batteries that quickly... Tried good Duracell, then good lithium ion rechargeable batteries, but neither worked any longer than the other. Waste of about $20 right there... It also has a really flimsy battery cover to it... battery life doesn't deserve the 1 star. Overall I was generous and gave it a 2...
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great light for the price, but weird battery life.
customer_reviews.text: This light is awesome it is very bright and good quality. The only down side is that when you leave the batteries in the light they die. It would not that big of a deal to me if it did not use so many batteries. Even though the light drains the batteries it doesn't mean it is not a good product. If you don't want to take the batteries out or just forget easily just make sure you have a lot of double A's!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, batteries wouldnt work, couldn't power on.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this thinking it was convenient for a portable light. The 1st one I received was defective, would not power on, tried brand new batteries and rechargeable ones that didnt work as well. Ordered a replacement which also was defective. Very cheaply made, flimsy back housing, and overall extremely poor build quality. Going to invest in another model.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: The light is quite bright and has good coverage under indoor lighting conditions. This is a quality product if you look at the battery compartment. All batteries fit in nice and tight, not too tight. It uses quite a few batteries. The price is reasonable for an item like this. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Poly Mixa

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add light to a room for photography or an event.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Allows you to add really bright light to a room for photography or for an event. Having two or more gives the most flexibility for lighting solutions, so you have to get multiple units, but at their price point, it really isn't an issue. Simply to use and these are highly portable. I have flown with these multiple times in checked luggage (with padding) and I've had no issues at all. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Meko

customer_reviews.title: Will discharge battery even when off
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product 5 stars, but I noted that the AA batteries I left in it were going flat even without the light being used. Checking with a multimeter indicates that the unit draws 6.5 mA with the switch completely off. This will flatten a freshly-charged set of 1900 mAh rechargeable AAs in less than 2 weeks, so I would recommend removing the batteries when the light is not going to be used for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but tough
customer_reviews.text: I only buy the cheap on camera led’s because inevitably they will fall. I have many of these. And they still work after falling. So they might seem cheap but they can take a beating. Too: put a rubber band around them and the battery pack so when it falls hopefully your batteries won’t go everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Great little dimmable light!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it's technically a video light, it has worked great for photography use! I mainly use it when I'm shooting weddings and the reception is too dark for the camera to lock focus. It has an adjustable dimmer so I can use just the right amount of light I need. I have used it on high for ring shots too versus using flash and it's worked fine (see pictured). I'm glad I got this light and because of it's dynamic use, I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: K. CravenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this light. Very bright. Illuminates a dark room and you can use it with or without filters. It has two filters. One is a diffuser which lets the light remain at 5600k and one is a 3200k filter. It gives off a nice hue with the 3200k filter. It uses 5 different types of batteries. I am using 6 AA batteries. We’ll see how long those last.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just as described very bright comes with a nice some what sturdy plastic case for diffusers amber and frosted that just slides in tabs on the front of the light also has also has two built in battery adaptors for the sony, fh,fm and f models and extra adaptor for the panasonic then to install 6 AA just remove cover and install with out the extra panasonic adaptor turns on by a dimmer switch on the side also the battery level indicator lights on the back size of unit about 6 inches wide about 4 inches tall , 2 1/2 inches deep stands 5 1/2 inches from hot shoe to top of light case
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Master the light!
customer_reviews.text: Lost my first one, have a feeling someone stole it.. Anyway, I bought it again and it works great! I use this while I go up in the club! haha, but no really. It's the party light, after a few drinks people love it...or hate it. It's pretty damn bright but not too crazy. I use a rechargeable battery and lasts long enough for all the times i've needed it. Mounts to the top of your cam easily, mounts to light stands etc.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Campos

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price - but have a couple complaints
customer_reviews.text: Good light. I only gave it 4 stars due to a few design imperfections and build issues. I bought two and one had one LED out. (Not a problem, given how many are there). But one thing I don't like is there was no rear-cover over the battery compartment for when you're using AA cells. Just looks like something is missing. The swivel mount thing is also a bit hard to adjust. Not terrible, but not 5 star operation.
customer_reviews.author: Optimist

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay on as it should
customer_reviews.text: This light does NOT stay on! It goes off every few seconds and I have to manually turn it off then back on again tonget it to turn back on. I don’t know if it’s defective or is it really just this awful?!? If this isn’t the right way it’s supposed to work I’d be happy to update this review of the company can explain why my light doesn’t work. I blasted through batteries extremely fast also. Less annoying than the light going off constantly of course.
customer_reviews.author: CKohl

customer_reviews.title: Light for camera or camcorder
customer_reviews.text: I can truly say that this is a powerful lighting for a Camera or camcorder. Are used it the first time last year and I almost blinding everyone so I had to learn to turn the lighting down. Other than that it does what it needs to do and it’s a very good product
customer_reviews.author: Shortcake

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Huge piece of junk. It somehow drained six AA batteries while sitting unused for three days. Even with full batteries it would randomly turn itself off. If you need something reliable, don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Batteries can be a bit tedious. I'm usually recording on the go so it ...
customer_reviews.text: Package was delivered non-damaged and on time. I'm actual quite impressed on the quality of lighting. I do advise that you purchase the battery pack(s) that fit this model. Batteries can be a bit tedious. I'm usually recording on the go so it works best for fast lighting situations. It's extremely easy to use and the dim feature comes in handy. Surprisingly doesn't look as cheap as I thought it would be. Aesthetically acceptable for professional shoots yet, it's functionality will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer II

customer_reviews.title: Bright, small and surprise: It's sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Gets very bright, but the dimmer is smooth and I can easily find my sweet spots. Eats up the batteries, But Hey, It's Bright. The plastic base and locking ring was a concern at first, but they honestly do very well. I might even look into some different color gel plates soon as diffuse white and orange are pretty useful, but make me want more. It's a small light for the output, so it fits nicely into my camera bag. Bring some extra batteries for long setups and/or shoots, but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramiah J BoltonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: OK but would buy a different light in the future
customer_reviews.text: This light puts out and works well with double A's. However its very difficult to place a EN battery on it as the attachment is hard to place. Also shows signs of wear and tear with some corrosion on the terminals already. Served my needs when I bought it, but I would upgrade to a better light in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bryson Harold Kim

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: This light has saved me at numerous night time events including outdoor weddings! I absolutely love that you can soften the light with the accessories it comes with as well as control the brightness. I was afraid it would drain batteries quickly because it does require 6 AA's, however I have used this light now for 4 separate events and haven't had to replace the batteries yet. I prefer this light over my external flash because I can see in advance how the lighting will be applied to the picture, rather than be surprised by the flash.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey L.

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. I use it for filming with a video camera on subjects that are moving unpredictably. Mount the camera and this light on an X-grip and use this as your "key light". Has a wheel on the side to raise or lower the intensity of the lighting during filming. Professional quality results at a reasonable price. Battery pack has lasted me through hours of filming (although I got a spare with charger just in case).
customer_reviews.author: Desert Guy

customer_reviews.title: Makes my video look like professional!
customer_reviews.text: Great LIGHT! Use it to look professional when videoing with my ULANZI U Rig Pro Smartphone Video Rig. Fills the light well, and comes with a yellow and white diffuser. Plus you can buy extra "video camera" batteries to use on it so you have recharging capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Bright with a good battery life
customer_reviews.text: I am more than impressed with this little light. It may be small but it is extremely bright and wont burn through batteries. I like that it can connect to a hot shoe as well as be mounted onto a stand. It doesn’t weigh very much either so when it is on the camera it isn't too noticeable. Very useful indoors, especially if working at a wedding where lighting tends to be a littler darker during the reception. Having this on my camera makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Long Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good for shedding light on people and items 4-6 feet away.
customer_reviews.text: Adding the AA batteries make it significantly more heavy and the back battery cover is flimsy. If you drop it, the batteries and cover will most likely pop out. I like how it is dimmable and have used in at a wedding and reception with low lighting. I have also used the full brightness during the day with natural light to bring out the colors in items I was photographing to sell online. Definitely a good purchase, light gets thrown about 4-6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: FALLS OFF CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this and it's just okay. First of all, there is no BACK to keep the batteries from falling out. If you use AA batteries, they are exposed. Secondly, it keeps loosening and falling off my Canon 7D II randomly. I am constantly having to make sure it is tightened for fear that it will just fall off in the middle of me using it. The light it emits, is okay. It does the job I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Raintree

customer_reviews.title: product was dead when its arrive
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days when this product finally arrives at my address, I found its dead/ not working. It's really frustrating after long time money invest, time invest all is lost. They should release a product market after the QA check. Total time waste. Even I get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Shamim

customer_reviews.title: If this product want giving me issue it would have gotten a 5stars because it’s bright as hell
customer_reviews.text: It’s really bright when I get it to work but something is wrong with it the batteries keeps getting loose so while film with it the light just shuts off with out warning and then starts to blink the red test light and all the batteries are brand new and when I just move the batteries a little then it turns on again .
customer_reviews.author: Mane smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst, do not buy. 30 minutes into using with new batteries, it started turning on and off. I replaced batteries again and it did the same thing. This happened the very first day I got it. Very bad quality, do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure just how bright this would be. I work in video, and wanted some new gear for different shoots. This is pretty exceptional. I can actually light up a whole room in my house with this thing. It takes 6 AA batteries, but they won't last long. This thing has a LOT of power to it. I'd recommend getting a battery for it. NEEWER makes regular batteries for it. Look for the F550 that is compatible with the CN-160 (which is the light here). The light sits in a hot foot, but isn't powered by the camera at all. The lights are adjustable, and come with two diffusers. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Bright, dimmable, reliable, lightweight, well-made and worth every penny.  I bought multiple!
customer_reviews.text: I own more than one of these and really like them. I power them with a dozen Sony NP-F960 and 970 batteries, for which I bought some two-battery chargers. These lights are pretty darned bright and I love that they're dimmable. Technology sure has gotten good and inexpensive! I recommend these lights for those shooting interviews, talking heads, still life photographs, run & gun video and more. I've produced documentaries in my previous life and shot a lot of professional photography, so I wish I'd have had these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: If you need a steady light for photos or videos, this is the light you need. The brightness level is great and is perfect for me when I shoot videos in an area with low lighting. The colors are well balanced and the item is light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful light
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for such a wonderful light. Small but packs a punch when turned up to max, capable of being used as the only light source and still giving some great pictures/videos. Batteries have a good life, especially with the rechargeable ones over the AA. Works best when mounted on a camera, but it does work well on a stand for some background effects. Even has a pretty solid casing to prevent damage. Can’t go wrong with this light for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Abelard Price

customer_reviews.title: Use battery pretty quick
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this to shoot video for my kid so I never turn this to highest brightness. It takes 6 AA battery, I use the duracell alkaline battery, it lasts about 2-3 hours and batteries will die. Other than the battery issue, I think this is still a value product, for just a roughly $20 price, it is worth what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Light
customer_reviews.text: It's a great light for photography, videos, etc. It's pretty bright, great for casting out shadows, and comes with filters. I just really wish it came with at least one rechargeable battery. That way you can take advantage of the battery holder that is included.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Very handy light
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for macro photography, and along with a film digitizer as a light source. A great and inexpensive light source that does perfectly what it's intended to do. I'm currently using regular alkaline batteries, but I think I'm going to splurge for the Lithium-Ion rechargeable battery and charger. Battery life so far has been fine.
customer_reviews.author: ZZiglar

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use continuous lighting that didn't break the bank. Extremely lightweight and holds a charge for a extremely long time. Gets bright enough o fill up a whole room and works really great for filming in a lot of different lighting situations. Really impressed that a light this cheap can put out so much power.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This light is awesome, and was such an amazing price. It fits perfectly on my tripod, and I've been using AA batteries in it for an impressive amount of time, so I'm guessing it doesn't suck up too much power. It has taken my photos and videos from "meh DIY" to "woah, DIY??" (At least in my humble opinion).
customer_reviews.author: Carson O.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Multi purpose light panel, great for shooting photos and videos since it's consistent, much more useful than a flash, this light mounts directly on top of my camera and consistently shines and lights up my whole frame. Even more consistent since it attaches to my camera so the lighting doesn't change since it moves with me. Lightweight and little so it's not heavy or bulky. Takes two different type batteries so I it's easy either way to power it up. The adjustable brightness and color filters make the lighting lovely no matter the shade. Great quality and solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Luiram Pro

customer_reviews.title: Fried out after first use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this LED panel along side with the Neewer CN-AC2 power adapter for it and after the first use to test it with my camera, it will not turn on anymore. It'll only flash somewhere just before hitting the max on the On-Off dial but nothing more than that. I've tried some stand alone AA batteries just to check if it was a problem with my power adapter but no luck there. The LEDs in the back are lighting though so I know both the adapter and the AAs are perfect. One other thing is that I noticed a burning smell coming from the dial itself so something internal must've fried after the first boot. I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McGraw

product_meta.title: NEEWER 160 LED CN-160 Dimmable Ultra High Power Panel Digital Camera / Camcorder Video Light, LED Light for Canon, Nikon, Pentax, Panasonic,SONY, Samsung and Olympus Digital SLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingCompatible Battery (Not Included): AA Ni-MH or Alkaline battery; Panasonic SD Series Li-ion Batteries; Sony Li-ion Battery FH, FM and F models. NOTE: Sony FW series battery can not work with the LED panel.

The Neewer CN-160 can mount to any standard hot shoe on most DSLR or digital video cameras as well as tripods and light stands equipped with a hot shoe mount or 1/4" thread. It is also equipped with a pivoting head, allowing you to raise or lower the light's angle. The light is battery powered and requires 6x AA Lithium Ion batteries (not included). With the included battery adapter, you can substitute the AA batteries for Sony NP-FH NP-FM NP-F Series, or Panasonic CGR-D16S rechargeable batteries. Battery life can easily be monitored using the battery power indicator located under the battery compartment. The Neewer CN-160 LED Video Light is easy to install and use and will make a great addition to your photography or video studio.

Features:
The LED camcorder lamp light allows you to link lights together to make larger light. Features 160-LED lights for optimum illumination and diffuser. Helps to ensure your pictures's perfect settings. This super lightweight 160-piece-LED item can be used in video taking,either for lights setup or supplement. There are 2 filters included with this item, with Spotlight effect, Diffuse effect, and for reducing the color temperature to 3200K. The light intensity can be changed to offer professional effects. Designed with Standard hot shoe plug, so can be installed on the DV or DSLR, and DC with standard hot shoe. Rotate switch for on/off and brightness adjustment. Adopts concentration LED lights, irradiation distance can reach more than 5m, suitable for long distance shooting. the light can also be adjusted from concentrating light to diffusing light which is suitable for short distance shooting. Compatible batteries (not included): Sony NP-FH NP-FM NP-F Series Li-ion rechargeable battery Panasonic CGR-D16S rechargeable battery Alkaline/NiMH AA Battery Suitable for: Can be installed on many Cameras like Canon, Nikon, Sigma Olympus, Pentax, etc.

Specifications:
Maximum Power: 9.6 Watt
Material of the Lighting's Shell: ABS Plastic
Color Temperature: 5600K (3200k w/filter)
Luminous flux: 660 lm
Video light size: 141mm x 62mm x 150mm
Runtime: 60-80mins
Illumination: 900Lux (1m), 240Lux (2m), 120Lux (3m), 70Lux (4m), 40Lux (5m)
Effective distance: 6m/20ft
Size: 141x62x150 mm
Weight: 8.57oz
feature_bullets: 160-LED lights for optimum illumination and diffuser.
There are 2 filters included with this item, with Spotlight effect, Diffuse effect, and for reducing the color temperature to 3200K
The light intensity can be changed to offer professional effects.
Rotate switch for on/off and brightness adjustment.

Compatible Battery (NOT INCLUDED): AA Ni-MH or Alkaline battery; Panasonic SD Series Li-ion Batteries; Sony Li-ion Battery FH, FM and F models. NOTE 1: Sony FW series battery can not work with the LED panel; NOTE 2: Batteries are needed to be taken out if not in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,763 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
